alert.note: Alert for Eastern, Central, and Southern Searcy County Higher Elevations; Johnson County Higher Elevations; Newton County Higher Elevations; Northwest Yell County; Pope County Higher Elevations; Southern Johnson County; Southern Pope County; Southern and Eastern Logan County; Western and Northern Logan County (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 10:15AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Logan, southwestern Searcy, southern Newton, Johnson, north central Yell and northwestern Pope Counties through 1045 AM CDT... At 1015 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Devils Knob to Paris. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarksville... Paris... Lamar... London... Knoxville... Subiaco... Hartman... Scranton... Ratcliff... Witts Spring... Moore... Devils Knob... Hoyt... Midway in Logan County... Holman... Rosetta... Dillen... Woodland... Hinkle... Walnut... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
